concept.title: Concept Topic Type
concept.shortdesc: This topic explains the purpose, characteristics, and common use cases of the Concept topic type.

conbody.p: In DITA (Darwin Information Typing Architecture), a topic is a fundamental type of topic designed to provide high-level explanations and background information about a specific subject or topic. It serves the primary purpose of answering the question, "What is it?"

section.title: Purpose
section.p: The primary purpose of a Concept topic is to convey fundamental understanding and context about a subject matter. It aims to provide readers with a broad overview and foundational knowledge without delving into specific procedures or tasks.

li.p: Concept topics offer a high-level understanding of a topic or concept, presenting information in a manner that is easily digestible and devoid of detailed procedures.
They include definitions, explanations, examples, and analogies to clarify complex ideas and terminology.
Concept topics do not provide step-by-step instructions or specific tasks to perform. Instead, they focus on knowledge transfer and comprehension.
Concept topics are commonly used for introducing readers to new software applications, technologies, or complex subjects.
They are employed to explain terminology, principles, theories, or abstract concepts.
Concept topics serve as a valuable resource for providing background context and foundational knowledge that can be referenced in more detailed topics.
